result.execSummary:
The defendant Qureonte Romero Pope was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

charges.descr: Endanger Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm into Vehicle or Building)

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 327 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Employment or school. Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
Successfully complete an Anger Management Program.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Restitution set at zero. Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/7/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/7/17; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 4/7/14 for Olivia A. for 2 appearances on 9/25/13 and 1/15/14; Telis W. and Arlacsha W. for 3 appearances each on 9/25/13, 1/15/14, and 4/7/14.

Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED and READ IN.
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 327 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/7/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 4/7/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete an Anger Management Program
-Complete 20 hours of community service
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Defense Motion in Limine, received and filed. sab

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Qureonte Romero Pope not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Attorney Sargent was attending to matters in other courts and there was not a DA available to cover this case in the PM. Final Pretrial rescheduled for 3/27/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of a PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing on 01-24-2014 received and filed. (12 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Assistant State Public Defender Stephen Sargent, 819 N 6th Street, Milwaukee, WI  53203.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
NO COURT FILE.
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 3/14/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 4/7/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in custody.  Denis Stingl for Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Blaine Grabowski.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #2010JV000600 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy and waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Arlacsha W.; DW (11 years old); TW (13 years old); DM (14 years old); OA (17 years old) and Davonte DM

Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Defendant Qureonte Romero Pope in custody.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
